title: Question 1
prompt: Which statement best expresses the difference in point of view between these two artists’ renderings?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

Compare the painting of Louis XVI being led to the execution, “Louis XVI au pied de l’échafaud” by Charles Benazech, 1793, to the illustration “The Execution of Louis XVI.”
feedback: In the painting by Benazech, Louis XVI is being led to the guillotine by the revolutionaries. Louis XVI is emphasized as the central figure in the painting. His sorrowful expression and his outstretched hand show the king as a man to be pitied, contrasted with the cheering of the crowd at the king’s death in the contrasting picture. Benazech’s portrait is more sympathetic to the dethroned ruler.
